item.title: 聚焦：南非 Takealot 公司押宝乡镇，抵御全球竞争对手
item.description: 南非最大的电子商务零售商 Takealot 的首席执行官告诉路透社记者，该公司已经雇佣了数千名个人购物者，以帮助其向乡镇和农村地区渗透，抵御来自全球竞争对手日益激烈的竞争。【原文：South Africa's biggest e-commerce retailer, Takealot, has hired thousands of personal shoppers to help it penetrate townships and rural areas and fend off increased competition from global rivals, its CEO told Reuters.】

item.title: 类似 Instagram 的中国小红书在电子商务销售方面取得进展
item.description: 自从 Tera Feng 八年前开始在中国社交媒体上记录她令人羡慕的上海生活方式，包括参观艺术画廊和参加时尚活动以来，她已经积累了 50 多万粉丝。【原文：Since Tera Feng started documenting her enviable Shanghai lifestyle, including visits to art galleries and fashion events on Chinese social media eight years ago, she has built up a following of more than 500,000 people.】

item.title: 诺和诺德将投资 12 亿美元在丹麦新建工厂
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）周一表示，将投资 85 亿克朗（12.0 亿美元）在丹麦欧登塞（Odense）新建一座生产罕见病药物的工厂。【原文：Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk will invest 8.5 billion crowns ($1.20 billion) in a new facility in Odense, Denmark, for the production of rare disease drugs, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 塔瓦雷斯离职后，Stellantis 在埃尔坎的领导下迅速调整战略
item.description: 在董事长约翰-埃尔坎（John Elkann）的领导下，菲亚特、吉普和公羊等 14 个品牌的所有者 Stellantis 正在迅速采取行动，废除前任首席执行官的遗产，修复与经销商、行业合作伙伴、政府和工人的关系。【原文：Steered by Chairman John Elkann, Stellantis , owner of 14 brands including Fiat, Jeep and Ram, is acting swiftly to dismantle the legacy of its former CEO and repair relations with dealers, industry partners, governments and workers.】

item.title: 穆迪评级将中国 2025 年 GDP 预期从 4.0% 上调至 4.2
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）表示，已将中国2025年国内生产总值（GDP）增长率预期从4.0%上调至4.2%，因为该公司预计信贷条件将趋于稳定，而且中国政府自9月份以来的刺激措施将减轻美国可能提高关税所带来的一些影响。 该公司在周一发布的一份报告中发表了上述评论。【原文：Moody's Ratings said it had raised China's 2025 GDP growth forecast to 4.2% from 4.0%, as it expected credit conditions to stabilise and Beijing's stimulus efforts since September to mitigate some impact from potentially higher U.S. tariffs. The comments were made in a report published on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞标中国消费者停止购物
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 落后的欧洲市场可能是 2025 年最重要的复苏交易
item.description: 欧洲金融市场已经受到美国关税担忧以及法国和德国政治动荡的沉重打击，未来一年的形势不容乐观。【原文：The year ahead is shaping up badly for Europe with its financial markets already hit hard by U.S. tariff fears and political turmoil in France and Germany, yet some investors are calling peak pessimism and hunting for bargains amid the gloom.】

item.title: 统计局：尽管增长放缓，中国消费复苏仍在继续
item.description: 中国统计局新闻发言人付令辉周一在北京举行的媒体吹风会上表示，尽管11月份零售额同比增速较10月份有所放缓，但中国消费复苏的趋势没有改变。【原文：The trend of China's consumption recovery has not changed despite year-on-year retail sales growth in November having slowed from October, China statistics bureau spokesperson Fu Linghui said at a media briefing in Beijing on Monday.】

item.title: 中国工厂产出增长，但消费仍是拖累因素
item.description: 中国 11 月份的工业产值增长略有加快，但零售额却令人失望，这使得中国政府继续面临为脆弱的经济加大刺激力度的压力，因为它要为特朗普第二任政府征收更多美国贸易关税做好准备。【原文：China's industrial output growth quickened slightly in November, while retail sales disappointed, keeping pressure on Beijing to ramp up stimulus for a fragile economy as it braces for more U.S. trade tariffs under a second Trump administration.】

item.title: 一些日本买家同意第一季度铝溢价比第四季度高 30% - 消息来源
item.description: 两位直接参与谈判的消息人士称，一些日本铝买家已同意向一家全球生产商支付每吨 228 美元的溢价，作为 1 月至 3 月船运的基准价格，比本季度上涨 30%。【原文：Some Japanese aluminium buyers have agreed to pay a global producer a premium of $228 per metric ton over the benchmark price for shipments from January to March, up 30% from this quarter, two sources directly involved in the talks said.】

item.title: 中国 11 月工业产值增长 5.4%，高于预期
item.description: 11 月份，中国工业产值同比增长 5.4%，增速高于 10 月份的 5.3%，这表明随着近期刺激措施开始发挥作用，这个世界第二大经济体已初步企稳。【原文：China's industrial output rose 5.4% from a year earlier in November, quickening from October's 5.3% growth, signalling tentative stabilisation in the world's second-largest economy as recent stimulus measures start to gain traction.】

item.title: 中国 1-11 月房地产投资同比下降 10.4
item.description: 国家统计局（NBS）周一的数据显示，继1-10月份下降10.3%之后，2024年前11个月中国房地产投资同比下降10.4%。【原文：Property investment in China fell 10.4% in the first eleven months of 2024 from a year earlier, after dropping 10.3% in January-October, National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data showed on Monday.】

item.title: 印尼央行本月将维持利率不变，因为外汇稳定性超过国内担忧
item.description: 在路透社（Reuters）的一项民意调查中，绝大多数经济学家都果断地预期印尼银行将在12月18日降息，但他们认为印尼银行将在周三维持关键利率不变，以支撑印尼盾。【原文：Bank Indonesia (BI) will hold its key interest rate steady on Wednesday to support the rupiah, according to a narrow majority of economists in a Reuters poll, who decisively expected a rate cut on Dec. 18 just a month ago.】

item.title: 11 月中国新房价格创 17 个月来最慢降幅
item.description: 周一的官方数据显示，中国新房价格创下17个月来最慢降幅，原因是政府加大了刺激措施的力度，以挽救受危机影响的房地产行业。【原文：China's new home prices fell at the slowest pace in 17 months, official data showed on Monday, as the government scaled up stimulus measures to lift the crisis-hit property sector.】

item.title: 美元在美联储会议前徘徊在三周高点附近；比特币突破 105,000 美元
item.description: 周一，美元对主要货币汇率徘徊在三周高位附近，因为市场预期美联储将在本周降息，但随后会发出在2025年采取有节制的宽松步伐的信号。【原文：The U.S. dollar hovered close to a three-week peak versus major peers on Monday amid expectations the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this week but then signal a measured pace of easing for 2025.】

item.title: 石油从几周来最高点回落，投资者关注美联储降息
item.description: 石油期货从几周来的最高水平回落，因为投资者在等待美联储本周晚些时候的会议，以寻找进一步降息的迹象。【原文：Oil futures eased from their highest levels in weeks as investors awaited a meeting of the Federal Reserve later this week for indication of further rate cuts.】

item.title: 中国 "情趣服装之都 "为特朗普和电商打压做好准备
item.description: 灌云县东部内衣产业的爆炸式发展部分得益于美国可能很快削减或取消的关税豁免。【原文：The development of the lingerie industry in eastern Guanyun county has exploded partly due to a U.S. tariff exemption likely to soon be curtailed or scrapped.】

item.title: 日本制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，日本工厂活动连续第六个月疲软
item.description: 周一的商业调查显示，由于需求低迷，日本的工厂活动连续第六个月萎缩，而服务业则在 12 月份扩大了涨幅，这凸显出日本经济对服务业的依赖性越来越强。【原文：Japan's factory activity shrank for the sixth straight month on lacklustre demand while the service sector extended gains in December, business surveys showed on Monday, highlighting the economy's increasing reliance on services.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英国批准丹尼尔-克雷廷斯基以 67 亿美元收购英国皇家邮政所有者的出价
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，英国政府已批准将英国皇家邮政出售给捷克亿万富翁丹尼尔-克里廷斯基（Daniel Kretinsky）。【原文：The British government has approved the sale of Royal Mail to Czech billionaire Daniel Kretinsky, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 亚洲对美联储利率前景和债券收益率高企保持警惕
item.description: 周一，在央行会议和重要经济数据密集的一周里，债券收益率飙升对股票估值提出了挑战，尤其是对定价丰厚的科技板块，亚洲股市情绪谨慎。【原文：Asian share markets were in a wary mood on Monday as surging bond yields challenged equity valuations, particularly for the richly priced tech sector, in a week packed with central bank meetings and major economic data.】

item.title: 制造业强劲，日本 10 月机械订单增加
item.description: 日本政府周一公布的数据显示，10月份日本核心机械订单环比增长2.1%。【原文：Japan's core machinery orders rose 2.1% in October from the previous month, government data showed on Monday.】

item.title: 韩国当局将继续监控金融市场
item.description: 韩国财政部周一表示，当局将继续监控金融和外汇市场。【原文：South Korea's finance ministry said on Monday authorities would continue monitoring financial and foreign exchange markets.】

item.title: 比特币首次突破 105,000 美元
item.description: 比特币周一在亚洲早盘交易中飙升至 105,000 美元以上的历史新高，延续了自共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）11 月当选美国总统以来的涨势。【原文：Bitcoin surged to a record high above $105,000 in early Asian trade on Monday, extending gains made since Republican Donald Trump, who has promised to champion cryptocurrencies, was elected U.S. president in November.】

item.title: 早间新闻：2024 年牛市进入最后冲刺阶段，中国 "数据大甩卖 "引人关注
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 澳大利亚将汇丰银行告上法庭，指控其忽视诈骗受害者
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构已对全球银行汇丰（HSBC）在当地的分支机构提起法律诉讼，称其未能正确回应约 950 起客户损失近百万美元或更多的报告。【原文：Australia's corporate regulator has initiated legal action against the local affiliate of the global bank HSBC , claiming it failed to correctly respond to about 950 reports of customers losing close to a million dollars or more.】

item.title: 马拉松底特律炼油厂工会工人投票批准协议
item.description: 在马拉松石油公司底特律炼油厂工作的卡车司机工会成员周日表示，他们投票批准了一项为期七年的集体谈判协议。【原文：Teamsters members working at Marathon Petroleum's Detroit refinery have voted to ratify a seven-year collective bargaining agreement, the union said on Sunday.】

item.title: 梅洛尼表示，如果能保留工作岗位和工厂，意大利愿意与 Stellantis 合作
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）周日表示，意大利政府愿意与 Stellantis NV 公司就该汽车制造商的未来战略开展合作，前提是该公司必须在意大利保留就业岗位和工厂。【原文：The Italian government is willing to work with Stellantis NV on the carmaker's future strategy provided it keeps jobs and factories in the country, Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Sunday.】

item.title: 尹炳世被弹劾后，韩国央行誓言保持市场稳定
item.description: 韩国总统尹锡烈因短暂实施戒严令而遭到弹劾，韩国央行周日誓言保持市场稳定。【原文：South Korea's central bank vowed on Sunday vows to keep markets stable after South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached over his brief imposition of martial law.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：美国外国投资委员会对新日铁交易意见不一
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周日援引几位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士的话报道称，美国财政部已通知新日铁，审查其收购美国钢铁公司计划的小组尚未就如何解决安全问题达成一致。【原文：The U.S. Treasury has informed Nippon Steel that the panel reviewing its proposed purchase of U.S. Steel has not yet come to an agreement on how to address security concerns, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing several sources familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 马斯克的 xAI 提供免费使用 Grok-2 人工智能聊天机器人的机会
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司 xAI 周六表示，其新版 Grok-2 聊天机器人将免费提供给社交媒体平台 X 的所有用户。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup, xAI, said on Saturday that its new version of the Grok-2 chatbot will be available for free to all users of the social media platform X.】
